title: Power restored after vehicle incident south of Francois Lake
source_url: file://imports/Burns Lake Lakes District News Burns Lake Lakes District News 05_21_2025 1.pdf
excerpt: BC Hydro responded to a power outage on Branch #50 Burns Lake the Southside near Tatalrose Lake that was caused by a motor vehicle incident. Power went out around 6:35 p.m. on May 13 and was still out
content_html: BC Hydro responded to a power outage on Branch #50 Burns Lake the Southside near Tatalrose Lake that was caused by a motor vehicle incident. Power went out around 6:35 p.m. on May 13 and was still out as of 8:30 a.m. on May 14, Thursday and Friday with no repair crew assigned yet, according to BC Hydro’s website. A repair crew was antici- open @ 4:00pm pated to arrive at 12 p.m. on May 14. The crew Saturdays open @ 3:00pm arrived on time and repairs were complete by 2:50 p.m., BC Hydro said. The area affected stretched from Grassy Dinner Hours 5:30pm - 8:00pm Plains in the east to an area west of McDonald’s Landing. There were 103 customers affected A power outage on the Southside affected 103 customers from May 13 to May 14. Friday Dinner Special and the outage lasted approximately 20 hours. (Submitted photo/Lakes District News) Salmon Dinner The outage comes as BC Hydro is preparing structures at the Burns Lake substation and 7 a.m. the following day, May 24.
